alert.note: Alert for Northeast Suffolk; Northern Nassau; Northwest Suffolk (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Statement issued September 30 at 3:48AM EDT until September 30 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 2 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Up to one half foot of inundation above ground level expected in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline. * WHERE...Northwest Suffolk, Northeast Suffolk and Northern Nassau Counties. * WHEN...From 11 AM this morning to 2 PM EDT this afternoon. * COASTAL FLOOD IMPACTS...Brief minor flooding of the more vulnerable locations near the waterfront and shoreline. * SHORELINE IMPACTS...Breaking waves of 2 ft on the north shore of Long Island, and 2 to 4 ft at Orient Point may result in beach erosion and flooding and possible localized dune erosion. Splashover bulkheads and dune structures may locally exacerbate flooding for shoreline roads and properties.

area.areaDesc: Northeast Suffolk; Northern Nassau; Northwest Suffolk
